hackathon-description-text: Hacking doesn’t mean breaking into anything - It’s breaking your ideas out of the confines of your mind and learning how to make them a reality.
hackathon-rules:
Please abide by the 
, it will be enforced throughout Pearl Hacks.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Automatic acceptance and all expenses paid to Global Hackathon Seoul in South Korea and Dell Android tablets for each team member.
Automatic acceptance and all expenses paid to HackingEDU in the Bay Area. Also, Parrot Minidrones for each team member from WillowTree Apps.
Amazon Prime Memberships, Google Cardboard, and GitHub t-shirts.
Pebbles for all team members to take home. Sponsored by Pebble.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best hack using the Pebble platform

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Rasperry Pi and VIRL personal subscription. Sponsored by Cisco.
Most fluid and functional interface. Design is clean and engages the user.
Submitted to the final round of Google's Computer Science Academy for graduating seniors.
Attendance to Qualcomm's Intern Women Conference at their headquarters in San Diego, CA over the summer.
Most innovative project related to preventing sexual assault or promoting sexual health.
Trips to the Grace Hopper Celebration in Houston, October 2015. Sponsored by Capital One.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Capital One APIs

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Interactive Intelligence Amazon Web Service credits.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Creative Integration of the Interactive Intelligence API

hackathon-location-address: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, 201 South Columbia Street, Chapel Hill, NC 27514, USA
hackathon-description-header: Pearl Hacks is a weekend event bringing together high school and college women from all over the United States to work on projects with mentors from software engineering companies.
